definition: An extreme or irrational fear of heights.
hindi_meaning: ऊँचाई से डर, ऊँचाई का भय
mnemonic: Acrophobia combines 'acro' (heights) and 'phobia' (fear), indicating fear of heights.
visual_representation: Picture someone standing at the edge of a tall building, trembling in fear, symbolizing acrophobia.
example_sentence: Her acrophobia made it impossible for her to enjoy the view from the top of the mountain.

definition: To give something as an honor or present.
mnemonic: Bestow sounds like 'be stow,' as in to stow or give something valuable to someone.
visual_representation: Imagine a king placing a crown on someone’s head, symbolizing bestowing an honor.
example_sentence: The university bestowed an honorary degree on the famous author.

definition: To make petty or unnecessary objections; a trivial objection or criticism.
hindi_meaning: बेवजह की आलोचना करना, तुच्छ आपत्ति
mnemonic: Cavil sounds like 'cave all,' where someone nitpicks at every little thing, like digging up minor faults.
visual_representation: Picture someone pointing out tiny flaws in a well-made painting, symbolizing caviling.
example_sentence: The critic caviled at the minor details of the film, ignoring its overall brilliance.

definition: To impose a misleading belief upon someone; to deceive or fool.
mnemonic: Delude sounds like 'delude,' like dilute the truth, meaning to deceive someone.
visual_representation: Imagine someone selling fake gold, deluding buyers into thinking it’s real.
example_sentence: He was deluded into thinking he could get away with the crime.

definition: A word or phrase expressing love or affection.
hindi_meaning: स्नेह या प्यार का शब्द, प्रेमसूचक शब्द
mnemonic: Endearment sounds like 'in dear,' as in something dear to your heart, showing affection.
visual_representation: Picture someone whispering 'sweetheart' or 'darling' to a loved one, symbolizing endearment.
example_sentence: She used terms of endearment when talking to her children, like 'my love' and 'dear.'

definition: A special or instinctive aptitude or ability for doing something well; stylishness and originality.
mnemonic: Flair sounds like 'flare,' as in a burst of talent or style.
visual_representation: Imagine someone with a natural talent for playing the piano, playing with style and ease, symbolizing flair.
example_sentence: He has a flair for writing compelling stories that captivate readers.

definition: To make a groove, hole, or indentation with a sharp tool or blade; to overcharge or swindle; a groove or hole made by gouging.
mnemonic: Gouge sounds like 'gouge out,' as in to dig out or hollow something with a sharp tool.
visual_representation: Picture someone using a chisel to carve out a piece of wood, symbolizing gouging.
example_sentence: The carpenter accidentally gouged a deep groove in the table while working on it.

definition: Excessively and unreasonably critical, especially of small faults.
hindi_meaning: अत्यधिक आलोचनात्मक, छोटी-छोटी बातों में नुक्स निकालने वाला
mnemonic: Hypercritical combines 'hyper' (excessive) and 'critical,' indicating overly critical behavior.
visual_representation: Imagine someone constantly criticizing every little thing, symbolizing hypercritical behavior.
example_sentence: Her hypercritical comments made it hard for anyone to enjoy the performance.

definition: Unable to be captured or broken into; invincible.
mnemonic: Impregnable sounds like 'impenetrable,' meaning something that cannot be breached or overcome.
visual_representation: Picture a fortress with high, thick walls that no enemy can breach, symbolizing impregnable.
example_sentence: The castle was considered impregnable, with walls so thick they could withstand any attack.

definition: A part of the trunk or a large branch of a tree that has fallen or been cut off; to enter an event or fact in a record.
hindi_meaning: लकड़ी का टुकड़ा, लॉग बुक में दर्ज करना
mnemonic: Log sounds like 'logbook,' where records are kept, or a literal log from a tree.
visual_representation: Imagine a large, heavy log of wood or someone writing details in a logbook, symbolizing recording.
example_sentence: The ship’s captain logged the coordinates and events of the day in the ship’s logbook.

definition: A collection of wild animals kept in captivity for exhibition; a diverse or unusual group of people or things.
hindi_meaning: वन्य जीवों का संग्रहालय, विविध समूह
mnemonic: Menagerie sounds like 'manage-ery,' like managing a collection of various animals or things.
visual_representation: Picture a zoo with various exotic animals in enclosures, symbolizing a menagerie.
example_sentence: The circus’s menagerie included lions, tigers, and a host of other exotic animals.

definition: Relating to sailors, ships, or navigation.
mnemonic: Nautical sounds like 'nautical mile,' a term used in sailing or navigation.
visual_representation: Imagine a sailor navigating a ship on the ocean, symbolizing something nautical.
example_sentence: The museum has a large collection of nautical instruments and maps from the 18th century.

definition: The scientific study of birds.
mnemonic: Ornithology sounds like 'ornitho-logy,' where 'ornitho' refers to birds and 'logy' means study.
visual_representation: Picture a scientist observing birds in the wild with binoculars, symbolizing ornithology.
example_sentence: His passion for bird-watching led him to study ornithology in college.

definition: A person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules or with displaying academic learning.
hindi_meaning: विद्वान होने का ढोंग करने वाला, शब्दाडंबरवादी
mnemonic: Pedant sounds like 'pendant,' as if someone hangs on every tiny detail like a pendant.
visual_representation: Picture a teacher constantly correcting students over trivial matters, symbolizing a pedant.
example_sentence: He is such a pedant that he insists on correcting everyone’s grammar, even in casual conversation.

definition: To stop oneself from doing something; a repeated line or number of lines in a song or poem, typically at the end of each verse.
mnemonic: Refrain sounds like 'refrain from,' meaning to hold back or repeat a part of a song.
visual_representation: Picture someone holding back from eating a dessert or the chorus of a song repeating, symbolizing a refrain.
example_sentence: Please refrain from talking during the performance.

definition: Showing dedication and diligence.
mnemonic: Sedulous sounds like 'schedule us,' as in someone who is diligent and sticks to their schedule.
visual_representation: Imagine a student studying late into the night, showing dedication to their work, symbolizing sedulous.
example_sentence: Her sedulous efforts in preparing for the exam paid off when she scored the highest marks.

definition: A person who behaves obsequiously to someone important; to act in an obsequious way.
mnemonic: Toady sounds like 'toad,' as if someone is bowing down low like a toad to flatter someone.
visual_representation: Picture someone constantly flattering their boss, agreeing with everything they say, symbolizing a toady.
example_sentence: The toady always agreed with the boss, hoping to get a promotion.

definition: Difficult to carry or move because of its size, shape, or weight; awkward or clumsy.
mnemonic: Unwieldy sounds like 'un-wield,' meaning difficult to handle or manage.
visual_representation: Imagine someone struggling to carry a large, awkwardly shaped box, symbolizing something unwieldy.
example_sentence: The package was so unwieldy that she had to ask for help to carry it.

definition: A tool with movable jaws that are used to hold an object firmly in place, typically while work is being done on it.
mnemonic: Vise sounds like 'vice grip,' indicating a tool that holds things tightly.
visual_representation: Picture a metal tool gripping a piece of wood tightly so it doesn’t move, symbolizing a vise.
example_sentence: He placed the wood in the vise before sawing it to ensure it wouldn’t move.

definition: Extreme anger.
mnemonic: Wrath sounds like 'wraith,' as in a ghostly anger, indicating intense fury.
visual_representation: Imagine someone’s face turning red with rage, symbolizing wrath.
example_sentence: The wrath of the king was feared by all who served in his court.
